articles.description: Wolves boss Julen Lopetegui is poised to leave the club with former Bournemouth manager Gary O'Neil set to replace him.
articles.title: O'Neil set for Wolves job with Lopetegui to leave

articles.description: Listen to BBC Radio 5 Live and Squad Goals coverage of the Carabao Cup, with 29 first-round ties on Tuesday.
articles.title: Listen: Carabao Cup - BBC Radio 5 Live updates on 29 first-round ties

articles.description: England forward Lauren James apologises for her red card during the Women's World Cup last-16 win over Nigeria.
articles.title: England's James apologises for World Cup red card

articles.description: Great Britain's Neil Fachie claims his 19th world title and Frances Brown also takes gold in the Cycling World Championships in Glasgow.
articles.title: GB's Fachie claims 19th world title in Glasgow

articles.description: Great Britain's Neil Fachie and Elizabeth Jordan beat Italy to win gold in the Mixed B Team Sprint at the Cycling World Championships 2023.
articles.title: 'They're flying!' - GB's Fachie & Jordan storm to sprint gold

articles.description: France cruise into the Women's World cup quarter-finals, thrashing Morocco to end the African side's dream run.
articles.title: France end Morocco dream to cruise into quarters

articles.description: Former England scrum-half Matt Dawson says England lack "world-class" players and do not know their best starting XV.
articles.title: 'Where are England's world-class players?' - Dawson

articles.description: Tottenham have completed deals for Argentina U20 forward Alejo Veliz and Netherlands Under-21 defender Micky van de Ven.
articles.title: Spurs sign forward Veliz and defender Van de Ven

articles.description: Marco Pantani's maverick life ended in a mysterious death. Nearly 20 years on, the questions and investigations continue amid claims that powerful criminals wanted Italy's star cyclist dead.
articles.title: Blood, cocaine and questions - the death of 'the Pirate'

articles.description: Caroline Wozniacki says she was "definitely a little rusty" following her first-round victory at the Canadian Open on her return to tennis after retiring in 2020.
articles.title: Wozniacki wins at Canadian Open on return to tennis
